articles.description: Chelsea defender Lewis Hall is a reported target for Newcastle, the Blues are linked with Nottingham Forest's Brennan Johnson, plus Premier League and Women's World Cup final build-up.
articles.title: Transfers latest and Premier League news conferences

articles.description: Liverpool sign midfielder Wataru Endo from Stuttgart for a fee of around 19m euros (£16.2m), subject to a work permit and international clearance.
articles.title: Liverpool sign Stuttgart midfielder Endo for 19m euros

articles.description: Sarina Wiegman says she has "no plans to leave" her job as England manager and intends to see out the rest of her contract, which lasts until 2025.
articles.title: Wiegman has 'no plans to leave' England job

articles.description: England white-ball captain Jos Buttler reveals conversations over Ben Stokes ending his one-day international retirement began "a while ago".
articles.title: Stokes made World Cup call '10 days after Ashes'

articles.description: Chelsea complete the signing of Belgium midfielder Romeo Lavia from Southampton in a £58m deal on a seven-year contract.
articles.title: Chelsea sign Lavia from Southampton in £58m deal

articles.description: British sprinter Adam Gemili says he turned to food for comfort after a run of poor form last year left him struggling.
articles.title: Gemili turned to food for comfort in 'worst time'

articles.description: Watch some of the best moments and goals from all of England's games on the road to Sunday's Women's World Cup final where they will take on Spain in Sydney.
articles.title: England's road to the Women's World Cup final

articles.description: Newcastle agree a loan deal with an obligation to buy with Chelsea for teenager Lewis Hall.
articles.title: Newcastle sign Chelsea teenager Hall on loan

articles.description: Ireland coach Andy Farrell describes the controversy over son Owen's current disciplinary process as a "circus" that is "absolutely disgusting".
articles.title: Farrell defends son Owen after 'disgusting circus'

articles.description: Fifa president Gianni Infantino says the success of the Women's World Cup has silenced critics who questioned expanding the tournament to 32 nations.
articles.title: Fifa has answered Women's World Cup critics - Infantino
